bibl.title: Letter from Frederick P. Reynolds to S.S. Goldwater, April 11, 1935

div1.p: Reynolds recommends Truby for a hospital position, describing his character and experience.

div1.head: Letter from Frederick P. Reynolds to S.S. Goldwater, April 11, 1935
div1.opener:
THE NEW YORK ACADEMY OF MEDICINE
COMMITTEE ON MEDICAL EDUCATION
2 East 103 Street
NEW YORK
April 11, 1935.
Telephone ATwater 9-4700
- ** -
* *
* *
DR. FREDERICK P. REYNOLDS, Medical Secretary
Dr. S. S. Goldwater
Commissioner of Hospitals
Municipal Building
New York City
My dear Doctor Goldwater:
div1.p:
I understand that General Albert E. Truby, Medical Department,
United States Army, is looking for a position in civil life after
he finishes his tour of duty as Commanding Officer of the Army
Medical Center, Washington, D. C.

No doubt you have received reports of General Truby's record as
Medical Officer of the Army, especially in hospital organization
and administration. His record is a most distinguished one.

I have known General Truby personally and intimately for perhaps
thirty years. I doubt if there is any officer in the Army who
commands greater respect as to integrity of character. His per-
sonality is such that although he is always frank and straight-
forward in expressing an opinion, he is liked and beloved by all
who have known him.
div1.closer:
Very truly yours, (Sgd.) Frederick P. Reynolds
Frederick P. Reynolds, M. D. FPR:vL
(Copy)
